SEARCH
Package com.mimecast.robin.smtp

Class MessageEnvelope

java.lang.Object
com.mimecast.robin.smtp.MessageEnvelope
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
public class MessageEnvelope extends Object implements Serializable, Cloneable
Message envelope.

This is the container for SMTP envelopes.

It will store the metadata associated with each email sent.

See Also:
  • Serialized Form

      public int getChunkSize()

      Size of how many bytes to write to the socket in one write.

      Returns:
      Chunk size in bytes.

    • setChunkSize

      public MessageEnvelope setChunkSize(int chunkSize)
      Sets chunk size.
      Parameters:
      chunkSize - Chunk size.
      Returns:
      Self.

    • isChunkBdat

      public boolean isChunkBdat()
      Is chunk BDAT command.

      This makes the client write the BDAT command with the first chunk of the message.

      This can uncover accidental buffer clearing when switching from SMTP to MIME mode.

      Returns:
      Boolean.

    • setChunkBdat

      public MessageEnvelope setChunkBdat(boolean chunkBdat)
      Sets chunk BDAT command.
      Parameters:
      chunkBdat - Boolean.
      Returns:
      Self.

    • isChunkWrite

      public boolean isChunkWrite()
      Is chunk write randomly.

      This will ignore chunk size and just write random size chunks.

      The chunks are limite to in between 1024 and 2048 bytes.

      Returns:
      Boolean.

    • setChunkWrite

      public MessageEnvelope setChunkWrite(boolean chunkWrite)
      Sets chunk write.
      Parameters:
      chunkWrite - Boolean.
      Returns:
      Self.

    • getTerminateAfterBytes

      public int getTerminateAfterBytes()
      Gets terminate after bytes.

      Size of how many bytes to write to the socket before terminating connection.

      Returns:
      Size in bytes.

    • setTerminateAfterBytes

      public MessageEnvelope setTerminateAfterBytes(int terminateAfterBytes)
      Sets chunk size.
      Parameters:
      terminateAfterBytes - Size in bytes.
      Returns:
      Self.

    • isTerminateBeforeDot

      public boolean isTerminateBeforeDot()
      Is terminate before dot.

      Terminate connection before transmitting the <CRLF>.<CRLF> termiantor.

      Returns:
      Boolean.

    • setTerminateBeforeDot

      public MessageEnvelope setTerminateBeforeDot(boolean terminateBeforeDot)

      Self.

      Boolean.

      Returns:
      Self.

    • getSlowBytes

      public int getSlowBytes()
      Gets slow bytes.

      This adds a write delay every given number of bytes.

      Must be >= 128 or the functionality will be disabled.

      Works only with file and stream not with headers and message.

      Returns:
      Size in bytes.

    • setSlowBytes

      public MessageEnvelope setSlowBytes(int slowBytes)
      Sets slow bytes.
      Parameters:
      slowBytes - Chunk size.
      Returns:
      Self.

    • getSlowWait

      public int getSlowWait()
      Gets slow wait.

      Wait time in miliseconds.

      Must be >= 100 or the functionality will be disabled.

      Returns:
      Chunk size in bytes.

    • setSlowWait

      public MessageEnvelope setSlowWait(int slowWait)
      Sets slow wait.
      Parameters:
      slowWait - Slow wait.
      Returns:
      Self.

    • getRepeat

      public int getRepeat()
      Gets repeat times.

      Send the same envelope this many times +1.

      Returns:
      Repeat times.

    • clone

      public MessageEnvelope clone()
      Creates a copy of this MessageEnvelope.

      Creates a new instance with all fields copied from this envelope.

      Note: date and msgId from the original are preserved in the clone.

      Collections and arrays are deep copied to ensure proper isolation.

      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:
      A cloned MessageEnvelope instance.
